Crimes.Legal_Issue: Denial of justice due to lawyer's incompetence; rebuttal of state protection presumption
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Oral testimony, lack of written documentation
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Fear of persecution due to document misrepresentation
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Failure to provide credible evidence of threats or state protection failure
Crimes.Assessment_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied to state protection
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Clear evidence of incompetence required for denial of justice
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Lawyer competence and state protection adequacy
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Rule on denial of justice and state protection presumption
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Credibility issues and failure to rebut state protection presumption
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of credible and corroborating evidence
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Claimant's right to fair hearing assessed
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Inconsistent reporting and lack of proof

Crimes.Crime_Type: Human Rights Violations and Serious International Law Offenses
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Involved: Charter of Rights and Freedoms, IRPA
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of persecution due to sexual abuse and lack of state protection
Crimes.Legal_Framework: International refugee law, Canadian domestic law
Crimes.Evidence_Requirement: Credible and corroborative evidence of abuse and risk
Crimes.Institutional_Action: RPD decision upheld by Federal Court
Crimes.Government_Body_or_Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board, Hungarian authorities
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Oral testimony, absence of medical or police records
Crimes.Complaint_Issues: Inadequate legal representation and lack of protection
Crimes.Protected_Group: Women at risk of gender-based violence
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Blatant injustice standard for denial of justice
Crimes.Protection_Claim: Need for state protection in Hungary
Crimes.Risk_Factor: Fear of reprisals after reporting abuse
Crimes.Enforcement_Action: No prior complaint filed with authorities

Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to Declare Relevant Information in Refugee Claim
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Failure to disclose relevant information (sexual abuse and threats)
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Refugee claim process with retestimony allowed
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Withholding information about abuse and threats
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Clear evidence of miscarriage of justice required
Crimes.Application_Factor: Reliance on legal advice for non-disclosure
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Claim dismissed due to credibility issues
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Procedural fairness and omission of facts
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Rule on full and frank disclosure in refugee claims
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Failure to disclose relevant information in a timely manner
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of corroboration for delayed disclosure
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Right to retestify but failure to explain delay
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Advice of counsel as justification for omission
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to report sexual abuse and threats

Crimes.Threat_Source: Alleged associates of accused in sexual abuse case
Crimes.Mitigating_Factors: No direct evidence linking threats to state actors
Crimes.Evidence_Sufficiency: Insufficient to establish nexus to Hungary
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Fear of persecution based on threats
Crimes.Review_Mechanism: Judicial review under section 72 of IRPA
